title: Apple Stores Slowly Reopening
summary:
Consumer electronics giant Apple (AAPL) plans a cautious approach to reopening its 510 retail stores worldwide as the threat from the coronavirus pandemic subsides.
As of Sunday, it had reopened 99 Apple Stores globally.
It began reopening its Apple Stores in China several weeks later.
On March 13, it closed all Apple Stores outside of Greater China to slow the spread of the disease.
Apple began reopening some of its retail stores outside of Greater China in April, starting in South Korea.
text:
Consumer electronics giant Apple (AAPL) plans a cautious approach to reopening its 510 retail stores worldwide as the threat from the coronavirus pandemic subsides. As of Sunday, it had reopened 99 Apple Stores globally.

X

This week, the iPhone maker expects to reopen 25 more stores in the U.S., 12 in Canada, and 10 in Italy, 9to5Mac reported Sunday.

In a letter to customers Sunday, Deirdre O'Brien, Apple's senior vice president of retail and people, said returning customers can expect significant changes at the reopened Apple Stores.

"In every store, we're focused on limiting occupancy and giving everybody lots of room," she said. "Face coverings will be required for all of our teams and customers, and we will provide them to customers who don't bring their own."

Temperature Checks, Deep Cleanings At Apple Stores

Apple Stores also plans to conduct temperature checks of customers at the door. Posted health questions will screen those with symptoms, such as cough or fever. It will also ask if anyone has had recent exposure to someone infected with Covid‑19.

"Throughout the day, we're conducting enhanced deep cleanings that place special emphasis on all surfaces, display products, and highly trafficked areas," O'Brien said. Plus, many stores will offer curbside pickup.

The reopening of Apple Stores is a positive step for the company as it attempts to return to normal operations, Wedbush Securities analyst Daniel Ives said in a note to clients Monday. He reiterated his outperform rating on Apple stock with a price target of 350.

"With stores opening up to strong demand throughout Asia and a handful of U.S. stores opening their doors, coupled by a recovering supply chain, which is on the path to normalization, it appears Apple is starting to lay the early groundwork for the next chapter of growth recovery," Ives said. Key for Apple will be the launch of the iPhone 12 later this year, he said.

'Twists And Turns' Forecast For The Road Ahead

Apple's O'Brien said the situation with Covid-19 is fluid.

"A store opening in no way means that we won't take the preventative step of closing it again should local conditions warrant," O'Brien said. "The response to Covid‑19 is still ongoing, and we recognize that the road back will have its twists and turns."

Apple was among the first companies to close its stores, starting in late January in mainland China with the early Covid-19 outbreaks. It began reopening its Apple Stores in China several weeks later.

On March 13, it closed all Apple Stores outside of Greater China to slow the spread of the disease. Apple began reopening some of its retail stores outside of Greater China in April, starting in South Korea.

On the stock market today, Apple stock rose 2.4% to 314.96.

Apple stock is on IBD's Leaderboard list as well as SwingTrader.

Follow Patrick Seitz on Twitter at @IBD_PSeitz for more stories on consumer technology, software and semiconductor stocks.

<li><a href="https://www.investors.com/category/news/technology/click/" rel="category tag">Click</a></li></ul> <h1 class="header1">
Apple Slowly Reopening Retail Stores As Covid-19 Threat Recedes	</h1>
<div class="featured-post-image-container"></div>
<div class="addtoany_share_save_container addtoany_content_top row">
<div class="share">
<div class="a2a_kit a2a_kit_size_25 addtoany_list" data-a2a-url="https://www.investors.com/news/technology/click/apple-slowly-reopening-retail-stores-as-covid-19-threat-recedes/" data-a2a-title="Apple Slowly Reopening Retail Stores As Covid-19 Threat Recedes"><a class="a2a_button_facebook" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/facebook?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fnews%2Ftechnology%2Fclick%2Fapple-slowly-reopening-retail-stores-as-covid-19-threat-recedes%2F&linkname=Apple%20Slowly%20Reopening%20Retail%20Stores%20As%20Covid-19%20Threat%20Recedes" title="Facebook" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/facebook.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Facebook"></a><a class="a2a_button_twitter" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/twitter?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fnews%2Ftechnology%2Fclick%2Fapple-slowly-reopening-retail-stores-as-covid-19-threat-recedes%2F&linkname=Apple%20Slowly%20Reopening%20Retail%20Stores%20As%20Covid-19%20Threat%20Recedes" title="Twitter" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/twitter.png" width="25" height="25" alt="Twitter"></a><a class="a2a_button_linkedin" href="https://www.addtoany.com/add_to/linkedin?linkurl=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.investors.com%2Fnews%2Ftechnology%2Fclick%2Fapple-slowly-reopening-retail-stores-as-covid-19-threat-recedes%2F&linkname=Apple%20Slowly%20Reopening%20Retail%20Stores%20As%20Covid-19%20Threat%20Recedes" title="LinkedIn" rel="nofollow noopener" target="_blank"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/linkedin.png" width="25" height="25" alt="LinkedIn"></a><a class="a2a_dd addtoany_share_save addtoany_share" href="https://www.addtoany.com/share"><img src="/wp-content/themes/ibd/dist/images/share-icons/email.png" alt="Share"></a></div> <a class="reprints-button sharing" href="https://www.ibdlicensing.com" target="_blank">Licensing</a>
</div>
<ul class="post-meta">
<li><span class="authors-links"><a href="https://www.investors.com/author/seitzp/" title="Posts by PATRICK SEITZ" class="author url fn" rel="author">PATRICK SEITZ</a></span></li>
<li class="post-time">04:31 PM ET 05/18/2020</li>
</ul>

<div class="single-post-content post-content drop-cap">
<p>Consumer electronics giant <strong>Apple</strong> (<a class='ticker' href='https://research.investors.com/quote.aspx?symbol=AAPL' target='_blank'>AAPL</a>) plans a cautious approach to reopening its 510 retail stores worldwide as the threat from the coronavirus pandemic subsides. As of Sunday, it had reopened 99 Apple Stores globally.</p>
<span>
<span style="width:50%;" class="video-player-container vms-left">
<span class="shortcode-video" vid-id="5834668" vid-dom-id="5834668-5ec494d135a35" vid-top="false" vid-repeat="1" vid-width="50" vid-url="https://content.jwplatform.com/manifests/MYsJMe2P.m3u8" data-captions="" vid-name="Stock Market News: Stocks Pop On Moderna News; Nvidia, Microsoft, JD.com Upgraded" vid-cat="IBD Live Highlights" vid-date="05/18/2020" vid-image="https://www.investors.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/MYsJMe2P-640x360.jpg" vid-authors="ALISSA CORAM">
<span class="close-mini-vid">X</span>
<span id="shortcode-video-player-5834668-5ec494d135a35" class="ready-to-load"></span>
</span>
</span>
</span><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stock Market News: Stocks Pop On Moderna News; Nvidia, Microsoft, JD.com Upgraded","description":"The IBD Live team discusses the headlines shaping Monday's trading session. For in-depth market insights and analysis of top stock making notable moves, make sure to watch the full show at investors.com\/ibdlive.","thumbnailUrl":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2020\/05\/MYsJMe2P-640x360.jpg","contentUrl":"https:\/\/content.jwplatform.com\/manifests\/MYsJMe2P.m3u8","uploadDate":"2020-05-18T09:11:09+0000","duration":"PT339.67S","author":"ALISSA CORAM","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Investor's Business Daily","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2018\/09\/ibd-logo.png"},"url":"https:\/\/www.investors.com"},"keywords":""}</script>
<p>This week, the iPhone maker expects to reopen 25 more stores in the U.S., 12 in Canada, and 10 in Italy, <a href="https://9to5mac.com/2020/05/17/apple-store-reopening-letter/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">9to5Mac reported</a> Sunday.</p>
<p>In a <a href="https://www.apple.com/store-opening-letter/" target="_blank" rel="noopener">letter to customers</a> Sunday, Deirdre O'Brien, Apple's senior vice president of retail and people, said returning customers can expect significant changes at the reopened Apple Stores.</p>
<p>"In every store, we're focused on limiting occupancy and giving everybody lots of room," she said. "Face coverings will be required for all of our teams and customers, and we will provide them to customers who don't bring their own."</p>

<h2>Temperature Checks, Deep Cleanings At Apple Stores</h2>
<p>Apple Stores also plans to conduct temperature checks of customers at the door. Posted health questions will screen those with symptoms, such as cough or fever. It will also ask if anyone has had recent exposure to someone infected with Covid‑19.</p>
<p>"Throughout the day, we're conducting enhanced deep cleanings that place special emphasis on all surfaces, display products, and highly trafficked areas," O'Brien said. Plus, many stores will offer curbside pickup.</p>
<p>The reopening of Apple Stores is a positive step for the company as it attempts to return to normal operations, Wedbush Securities analyst Daniel Ives said in a note to clients Monday. He reiterated his outperform rating on Apple stock with a price target of 350.</p>
<p>"With stores opening up to strong demand throughout Asia and a handful of U.S. stores opening their doors, coupled by a recovering supply chain, which is on the path to normalization, it appears Apple is starting to lay the early groundwork for the next chapter of growth recovery," Ives said. Key for Apple will be the launch of the iPhone 12 later this year, he said.</p>
<h2>'Twists And Turns' Forecast For The Road Ahead</h2>
<p>Apple's O'Brien said the situation with Covid-19 is fluid.</p>
<p>"A store opening in no way means that we won't take the preventative step of closing it again should local conditions warrant," O'Brien said. "The response to Covid‑19 is still ongoing, and we recognize that the road back will have its twists and turns."</p>
<p>Apple was among the first companies to close its stores, starting in late January in mainland China with the early Covid-19 outbreaks. It began reopening its Apple Stores in China several weeks later.</p>
<p>On March 13, it closed all Apple Stores outside of Greater China to slow the spread of the disease. Apple began reopening some of its retail stores outside of Greater China in April, starting in South Korea.</p>
<p>On the <a href="https://www.investors.com/market-trend/stock-market-today/stock-market-today-market-trends-best-stocks-buy-watch/">stock market today</a>, Apple stock rose 2.4% to 314.96.</p>
<p>Apple stock is on <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/leaderboard/?artProdLink=Leaderboard">IBD's Leaderboard list</a> as well as <a href="https://www.investors.com/product/swingtrader/?artProdLink=Swingtrader">SwingTrader</a>.</p>
